lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s plan, which calls for 100 new beds a year for the next three years, targets an age group that can often feels unwelcome in traditional shelters.
snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s plan, which calls for 100 new beds a year for the next three years, targets an age group that can often feels unwelcome in traditional shelters.

headline.main: New York to Add 300 Shelter Beds for Homeless Young People
headline.print_headline: Shelters to Add 300 Beds for Homeless Teenagers

abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio announces plan to add 300 shelter beds for older teenagers to New York City's shelter system in attempt to better serve age group that advocates warn is vulnerable to suicide and sex trafficking; plan will add 100 beds a year over three-year period, number advocates say will leave many of city's estimated 3,800 homeless youths in need.
